intro: Hackelia bhutanica, commonly known as the Bhutan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Bhutan and India. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are erect and branching. Hackelia bhutanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the local biodiversity of its native habitat.
